medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting, and diarrhoea for 3 days associated with abdominal cramps.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to admission with moderate abdominal pain in the lower abdomen and no history of fever or chills. The patient is unable to take any oral intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hyperlipidemia, anxiety, history of chest pain, constipation with one episode of rectal bleeding, cholelitiasis, and a previous fall followed by dizziness and lethargy.
